articles.headline: Valeant Forms Committee to Investigate Ties With Pharmacy
articles.snippet: Valeant Pharmaceuticals said in a conference call that its accounting was legal in connection with the pharmacy, Philidor Rx Services.
articles.abstract: Valeant Pharmaceuticals said in a conference call that its accounting was legal in connection with the pharmacy, Philidor Rx Services.
articles.lead_paragraph: Embattled Valeant Pharmaceuticals International said on Monday that its accounting related to its relationship with a specialty pharmacy was legal and appropriate, but added that its board was nonetheless forming a special committee to investigate the relationship.

articles.headline: Congress Strikes a Budget Deal With President
articles.snippet: The accord with Republican leaders would modestly increase domestic spending over the next two years and raise the federal borrowing limit.
articles.abstract: The accord with Republican leaders would modestly increase domestic spending over the next two years and raise the federal borrowing limit.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After five years of bitter clashes, Republican congressional leaders and President Obama on Monday night appeared to settle their last budget fight by reaching a tentative deal that would modestly increase spending over the next two years, cut some social programs, and raise the federal borrowing limit.

articles.headline: Lawyers Jostle for Lead Position in Volkswagen Diesel Suits
articles.snippet: To streamline the hundreds of suits filed against Volkswagen, a panel of federal judges is expected to consolidate them in a single court.
articles.abstract: To streamline the hundreds of suits filed against Volkswagen, a panel of federal judges is expected to consolidate them in a single court.
articles.lead_paragraph: The first battle in the legal assault on Volkswagen is unfolding as plaintiffs’ lawyers jockey over where tens of thousands of claims should be heard and which lawyers will get the biggest piece of the action.

articles.headline: A Banker Sees His Role in Cyprus as a Chance to Give Back
articles.snippet: Josef Ackermann, the former chief of Deutsche Bank who is now chairman of the Bank of Cyprus, had a role in the island’s crisis.
articles.abstract: Josef Ackermann, the former chief of Deutsche Bank who is now chairman of the Bank of Cyprus, had a role in the island’s crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: NICOSIA, Cyprus — The Swiss banker Josef Ackermann played a role in the events that nearly destroyed the Cyprus banking system in 2013. Now he was back in this sleepy capital, toiling to fix one of the very banks he helped undermine.

articles.headline: Study Cites Lower Standards in Law School Admissions
articles.snippet: The report by the nonprofit group Law School Transparency found that more law schools are admitting “at risk” students with lower admissions test scores.
articles.abstract: The report by the nonprofit group Law School Transparency found that more law schools are admitting “at risk” students with lower admissions test scores.
articles.lead_paragraph: As law schools across the country try to keep their classrooms full, many are admitting students with lesser qualifications, including those with a lower admissions test score — considered an important predictor of whether a graduate will earn the credentials to practice law.

articles.headline: President Joko Widodo of Indonesia Joins Trans-Pacific Partnership
articles.snippet: President Joko Widodo of Indonesia met with President Obama in Washington and said his country would eventually join the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
articles.abstract: President Joko Widodo of Indonesia met with President Obama in Washington and said his country would eventually join the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama won a crucial ally in his push for a sweeping Pacific Rim trade agreement on Monday when President Joko Widodo of Indonesia said during a White House visit that his country planned to join the pact, an important element of Mr. Obama’s foreign policy agenda.

articles.headline: The Republican Party’s Strategy to Ignore Poverty
articles.snippet: Fixed block grants have become a central part of the Republican strategy to confront America’s poverty, but states have powerful incentives to use the money elsewhere.
articles.abstract: Fixed block grants have become a central part of the Republican strategy to confront America’s poverty, but states have powerful incentives to use the money elsewhere.
articles.lead_paragraph: Arizona, where I was born, in July became the first state to cut poor families’ access to welfare assistance to a maximum of 12 months over a lifetime. That’s a fifth of the time allowed under federal law, and means that 5,000 more people will lose their benefits by next June.
